subject: Nutrition
title: Acid Reflux and GERD
description: A 60-second lesson on Acid Reflux and GERD.

hook.text: Heartburn has nothing to do with your heart. It's stomach acid splashing where it doesn't belong.

buildup.text: Acid reflux happens when the lower esophageal sphincter relaxes too much, letting acid escape upward.

discovery.text: Occasional reflux is normal. When it happens twice weekly or more, it's classified as GERD.

twist.text: Long-term untreated GERD can cause Barrett's esophagusâ€”a precancerous change in the tissue.

climax.text: Smaller meals, avoiding late eating, and elevating your head during sleep help most cases.

punchline.text: When the valve leaks, acid goes where it hurts.

quiz.question: What is GERD?
options: Chronic acid reflux occurring twice weekly or more
